intro: Denhamia bilocularis, commonly known as the two-chambered sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, hairy leaves and produces clusters of pale blue or violet flowers. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Denhamia bilocularis is well adapted to drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
